72 408-1 e 409-1 Operations  and suppliers  at significant  risk for incidents  of child  labor; and 
Operations  and suppliers  at significant  risk for incidents  of forced  or compulsory  labor  
 
 
 
 
 
 
	
	
	
Suppliers and operations identified as having significant risk for incidents of child labor (2020)  
Number of operations with risk of occurrence of child labor  1.5% of total Active CNPJs (724 CNPJs)  
Number of operations with risk of having workers exposed to hazardous work  0.9% of total Active CNPJs (433 CNPJs)  
Number of suppliers with risk of occurrence of child labor  0.5% of total Active CNPJs (13 CNPJs)  
Measures taken by the organization during the reporting period to contribute to the elimination of all forms of child labor 	
In the last quarter of 2020, we developed a social and environmental risk analysis process for credit operations, reinforcing  our diligence 
regarding the  issue of child labor. Additionally, in our Prohibited Activities List we have formalized the impediment to any level of 
relationship with companies that maintain child labor exploitation practices. 	
	
Suppliers and operations identified as having significa nt risk for incidents of forced or analogous to slave labor (2020)  
Number of operations with risk of forced or analogous to slave labor  4% of total Active CNPJs (2,110 CNPJs)  
Number of suppliers with risk of forced or analogous to slave labor  1% of total  Active CNPJs (27 CNPJs)  
Measures taken by the organization during the reporting period to contribute to the elimination of all forms of forced or ana logous to 
slave labor 		
In the last quarter of 2020, we developed a social and environmental risk analysis process for credit operations, reinforcing our diligence 
regarding the issue of slave labor. In our Prohibited Activities List we have formalized the impediment to any level of relat ionship with 
companies that maintain slave labor exploitation pra ctices. Additionally, we monitor the Slave Labor Black List (MTE) weekly to check 
new entries and delisting.
